commit_message:
Update dib script usage

Update manual dib mounting instructions to match changes made in the
tools/mount-image.sh script (I0deba1907f390f0d308ae6c8ed5448afbbf7688a)
and add a reference to the script itself in the documentation.

Change-Id: Ic72bf05f21cecb8bdff36956f3635c2f504c4dff

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-07 22:59:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Pass correct context to get_by_compute_node()

A recent change to the PciDevTracker class allowed for the passing of
the compute node ID to the __init__() method, where
PciDevsList.get_by_compute_node() was called with a 'context' parameter,
which wasn't defined, resulting in the imported context module being
passed instead. This change corrects that problem.

Change-Id: Id136eabacb00e4381c03f12d8484fc90a5eb48b1
Closes-Bug: #1408480
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-01-08 14:56:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Pass correct context to get_by_compute_node()

A recent change to the PciDevTracker class allowed for the passing of
the compute node ID to the __init__() method, where
PciDevsList.get_by_compute_node() was called with a 'context' parameter,
which wasn't defined, resulting in the imported context module being
passed instead.

This change requires that the appropriate admin context be passed in to
the __init__() for the PciDevTracker class, and that that be used to
create the PciDevsList. The existing import of the context module is no
longer needed in the pci/manager.py file, so the conflict is no longer a
problem. The only place in the code that currently instantiates a
PciDevTracker object is in the ResourceTracker, so that has been updated
to pass in the context. A unit test to check for context has also been
added.

Change-Id: Id136eabacb00e4381c03f12d8484fc90a5eb48b1
Closes-Bug: #1408480

commit_message:
Pass correct context to get_by_compute_node()

A recent change to the PciDevTracker class allowed for the passing of
the compute node ID to the __init__() method, where
PciDevsList.get_by_compute_node() was called with a 'context' parameter,
which wasn't defined, resulting in the imported context module being
passed instead.

This change requires that the context be passed in to the __init__() for
the PciDevTracker class, and that that be used to create the
PciDevsList. The existing import of the context module is no longer
needed in the pci/manager.py file, so the conflict is no longer a
problem. The only place in the code that currently instantiates a
PciDevTracker object is in the ResourceTracker, so that has been updated
to pass in the context. A unit test to check for context has also been
added.

Change-Id: Id136eabacb00e4381c03f12d8484fc90a5eb48b1
Closes-Bug: #1408480

commit_message:
Use common agent.linux.utils.ensure_dir method

We repeated os.makedirs(dir, 0o755) in several places. We should use
common neutron.agent.linux.utils.ensure_dir. Unit tests are also added.

Change-Id: Iaeae5ff7dc6676420c000d6501f69a5997ad4b6c
Closes-bug: 1419042

commit_message:
Add the ability to specify the sort dir for each key

Extend rest images api v2 with multiple sort directions support.
Example:
/v2/images/detail?sort_key=name&sort_dir=asc&sort_key=size&sort_dir=desc
Changed database api which now can take sort_dir param as a list.

python-glanceclient support will be added in separate commit.

Implements-blueprint: glance-sorting-enhancements
DocImpact
APIImpact
Change-Id: Ib43b53abfba7cb5789d916a014376cf38fc5245b

subject: Adds hypervisor_version_requires (ImagePropertiesFilter)
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-11 15:11:38.000000000', 'files': ['doc/config-reference/compute/section_compute-scheduler.xml'], 'message': 'Adds hypervisor_version_requires (ImagePropertiesFilter)

This is to prevent instances with newer tools from being
provisioned on older hypervisors.

Added comparison of hypervisor version from the
compute-node and image metadata in the image properties
filter.

In host scheduler image_prop_filter, the hypervisor_version_requires
image properties, if available, is compared to the host_state's
hypervisor_version, if available.

hypervisor_version_requires should be added on the image
as metadata and should have a operator and version value.
Examples : ">=6.0", ">6.0, <6.2", ""!=6.1".

Change-Id: I77dce6a5c28b5a25766b0273dc58a9dbb08defdd
Closes-bug: 1246231
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Adds hypervisor_version_requires (ImagePropertiesFilter)

This is to prevent instances with newer tools from being
provisioned on older hypervisors.

Added comparison of hypervisor version from the
compute-node and image metadata in the image properties
filter.

In host scheduler image_prop_filter, the hypervisor_version_requires
image properties, if available, is compared to the host_state's
hypervisor_version, if available.

hypervisor_version_requires should be added on the image
as metadata and should have a operator and version value.
Examples : ">=6.0", ">6.0, <6.2", ""!=6.1".

Change-Id: I77dce6a5c28b5a25766b0273dc58a9dbb08defdd
Closes-bug: 1246231

commit_message:
Send password to STDIN only if sudo is used

We shouldn't send password to STDIN if sudo command
isn't used, because it leads to unexpected commands
behaviour.

Closes-bug: #1431469

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11103, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'otc_cloud@163.com', 'username': 'intelotccloud', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11816, 'name': 'mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com', 'email': 'mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com', 'username': 'zzzeek'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-12 21:52:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Repair ArchiveTestCase to pass in all cases

ArchiveTestCase runs the archive_deleted_rows() routine
with a fixed limit of rows, and expects it to affect
specific tables which are then tested.  Since
this routine normally scans through all tables
in the model non-deterministically, it often locates
tables that also have archivable rows in them which are not
the target of the test, and then failing to delete
the expected rows since it only deletes up to a
fixed number.

This patch proposes one quick way to resolve, which is
to limit the tables that are considered by the routine
within the span of unit tests.   This might not be
the approach Nova devs want to take; another approach
may be to add more verbose inspection facilities
to archive_deleted_rows() so that the work it performs
can be tested in a more fine-grained way.

Change-Id: I015f4f02df0c944ef967d221fcfe5b75e7153ab5
Closes-bug: #1431571
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Repair ArchiveTestCase to pass in all cases

ArchiveTestCase runs the archive_deleted_rows() routine
with a fixed limit of rows, and expects it to affect
specific tables which are then tested.  Since
this routine normally scans through all tables
in the model non-deterministically, it often locates
tables that also have archivable rows in them which are not
the target of the test, and then failing to delete
the expected rows since it only deletes up to a
fixed number.

This patch proposes one quick way to resolve, which is
to limit the tables that are considered by the routine
within the span of unit tests.   This might not be
the approach Nova devs want to take; another approach
may be to add more verbose inspection facilities
to archive_deleted_rows() so that the work it performs
can be tested in a more fine-grained way.

Change-Id: I015f4f02df0c944ef967d221fcfe5b75e7153ab5
Closes-bug: #1431571

commit_message:
Use oslo_config choices support

The oslo_config library supports the choices keyword argument. This comment
leverages the use of choices for StrOpts in Glance's configuration.

Change-Id: I9edd0add96b12124459ae615cae7c9a443c8719f

subject: Change testr to run in serial
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-12 13:26:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Change testr to run in serial

This change implements the change to allow testr to run in serial which
should resolve most issues with tempest on a resource constrained host.

The problem that is being resolved here is that testr will, by default,
run in multi-threaded and has a relitively high probability to result in
a 503. This primarily impacts the gate jobs as they are built on a hosts
with 4 CPUs and 8GB of ram.

By default if the tempest script is run, testr will run multi-threaded.
However, if the environment variable RUN_TEMPEST_OPTS is set to
'--serial' then it will run in serial. This is done for the
gate-check-commit script so that the change only affects the AIO gate
check.

An additional environment variable TESTR_OPTS is added for further
flexibility.

Conflicts:
        scripts/gate-check-commit.sh
        scripts/run-tempest.sh

The above conflicts were due to the difference between master and this
branch with regards to the environment variable. In master all variables
are exported. This difference will be addressed in a subsequent patch.

Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
Closes-Bug: #1428847
Change-Id: I8c7ac72ef46ae3f3af3d3503081bec0cbe7276e9
(cherry picked from commit 255b94d425c0e6bb6a78868b12e5ef1fb4346354)
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-03-12 14:15:40.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/run-tempest.sh', 'rpc_deployment/roles/tempest/files/rpc_tempest_gate.sh', 'scripts/gate-check-commit.sh'], 'message': "Change testr to run in serial

This change implements the change to allow testr to run in serial which

The problem that is being resolved here is that testr will, by default,
run in multi-threaded and has a relitively high probability to result in
a 503. This primarily impacts the gate jobs as they are built on a hosts
with 4 CPUs and 8GB of ram.

By default if the tempest script is run, testr will run multi-threaded.
However, if the environment variable RUN_TEMPEST_OPTS is set to
'--serial' then it will run in serial. This is done for the
gate-check-commit script so that the change only affects the AIO gate
check.

An additional environment variable TESTR_OPTS is added for further
flexibility.

Conflicts:
        scripts/gate-check-commit.sh
        scripts/run-tempest.sh

The above conflicts were due to the difference between master and this

commit_message:
Change testr to run in serial

This change implements the change to allow testr to run in serial which
should resolve most issues with tempest on a resource constrained host.

The problem that is being resolved here is that testr will, by default,
run in multi-threaded and has a relitively high probability to result in
a 503. This primarily impacts the gate jobs as they are built on a hosts
with 4 CPUs and 8GB of ram.

By default if the tempest script is run, testr will run multi-threaded.
However, if the environment variable RUN_TEMPEST_OPTS is set to
'--serial' then it will run in serial. This is done for the
gate-check-commit script so that the change only affects the AIO gate
check.

An additional environment variable TESTR_OPTS is added for further
flexibility.

Conflicts:
        scripts/gate-check-commit.sh
        scripts/run-tempest.sh

The above conflicts were due to the difference between master and this
branch with regards to the environment variable. In master all variables
are exported. This difference will be addressed in a subsequent patch.

Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
Closes-Bug: #1428847
Change-Id: I8c7ac72ef46ae3f3af3d3503081bec0cbe7276e9
(cherry picked from commit 255b94d425c0e6bb6a78868b12e5ef1fb4346354)

commit_message:
Fix check for TMP_HOOKS_PATH

The check to make sure that TMP_HOOKS_PATH is set has an extraneous
'.' after the variable name.  This means that the check will always
evaluate to 'true.'

This has been fixed.

Change-Id: Ib68c7bbf5ec16c27fdbdbf55df9a8ccb2f5715ea

commit_message:
update ceilometer install guide and external service configuration

- change notification_driver option to use messagingv2.
*.openstack.common.* is pre-icehouse option.
- add note to configure swift metrics using new ceilometermiddleware
- update telemetry get_started guide:
  - generalise supported functions
  - fix notification agent and collector service purpose

Closes-Bug: #1425713
Co-Authored-By: Matt Kassawara <mkassawara@gmail.com>
backport: juno
Change-Id: I90dff1b5c2a7dd2943cfa7ff25bb63c08eb7986d

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-30 01:50:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove the unnecessary next link

Currently if the limit or osapi_max_limit equals to the length of the
volume list, a next link is generated in the response, though this next
link will return empty volume list. In fact it is unnecessary to generate
the next link in this case. This patch removes this useless link generation.

Change-Id: I0f1f449c73d51675281497a095d869c1e72c889f
closes-bug: #1350558

closes-bug: #1350558
', 'number': 7}, {'created': '2014-11-12 09:46:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove the unnecessary next link for volumes, transfers and backups

in the response, though this next link will return empty volume
list. In fact it is unnecessary to generate the next link in
this case.

* The method _get_collection_links has been called in volumes,
volume_transfers and backups. The patch can only affect the next
link generation for three of them. However, other lists like
consistency groups, qos specs, cgsnapshots have not implemented the
generation for the next link. Potentially this can be a wishlist
item for them.

', 'number': 47}, {'created': '2015-01-13 12:38:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove the useless next link for volumes, transfers and backups

Two cases this patch will resolve:
1) Currently if the number of items equals the osapi_max_limit or
the last page of items equals the osapi_max_limit without the
parameter limit set in the user request, a next link is generated
in the response, though this next link will return empty volume
list. In fact it is unnecessary to generate the next link in
this case.

2) If the number of items equals the osapi_max_limit and limit is
greater than osapi_max_limit, a next link is generated. Actually,
the next link does not need to be generated, because it is certain
that there is no more volumes left in the database.

The method _get_collection_links has been called in volumes,
volume_transfers and backups. The patch can only affect the next
link generation for three of them. However, other lists like
consistency groups, qos specs, cgsnapshots have not implemented the
generation for the next link. Potentially this can be a wishlist
item for them.

commit_message:
Remove the useless next link for volumes, transfers and backups

Two cases this patch will resolve:
1) Currently if the number of items equals the osapi_max_limit or
the last page of items equals the osapi_max_limit without the
parameter limit set in the user request, a next link is generated
in the response, though this next link will return empty volume
list. In fact it is unnecessary to generate the next link in
this case.

2) If the number of items equals the osapi_max_limit and limit is
greater than osapi_max_limit, a next link is generated. Actually,
the next link does not need to be generated, because it is certain
that there is no more volumes left in the database.

The method _get_collection_links has been called in volumes,
volume_transfers and backups. The patch can only affect the next
link generation for three of them. However, other lists like
consistency groups, qos specs, cgsnapshots have not implemented the
generation for the next link. Potentially this can be a wishlist
item for them.

Change-Id: I0f1f449c73d51675281497a095d869c1e72c889f
closes-bug: #1350558

commit_message:
Fixes VNX NotImplementedError of unmanage

When unmanaging a volume, cinder would call unmanage.
This fix is to add unmanage to avoid NotImplementedError.

Change-Id: I11539cc945d432e23bebf085cacb0023b9a6a1e3
Closes-Bug: 1429702

subject: Fix kwargs['instance'] KeyError in @reverts_task_state decorator
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11103, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'otc_cloud@163.com', 'username': 'intelotccloud', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-11 16:40:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Fix kwargs['instance'] KeyError in @reverts_task_state decorator

We use @reverts_task_state everywhere in the compute manager and we
ensure that 'instance' is a parameter to the decorator method via
@utils.expects_func_args('instance'), however, that only ensures there
is an instance argument, not that it's in args or kwargs (either is fine
for what expects_func_args checks).

The reverts_task_state decorator can get a KeyError when checking
kwargs['instance'] and fail to revert the task_state on the instance,
which can leave us in a bad state where non-admins can't delete the
instance if the task_state is not None (and the reset-state API is
admin-only).

This fixes the KeyError in the decorator by normalizing the args/kwargs
list into a single dict that we can pull the instance from.

Also adds a warning log if we fail the instance update since it
shouldn't happen and we want to know if it does because of the
aforementioned problems with deleting orphaned instances.

There isn't a specific unit test added for this since moving
kwargs['instance'] above the try/except in reverts_task_state makes a
lot of tests fail already if you don't have the normalize code.

Closes-Bug: #1423952

Change-Id: I70f464120c798422f9a3d601b7cdf3b0a8320690
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix kwargs['instance'] KeyError in @reverts_task_state decorator

We use @reverts_task_state everywhere in the compute manager and we
ensure that 'instance' is a parameter to the decorator method via
@utils.expects_func_args('instance'), however, that only ensures there
is an instance argument, not that it's in args or kwargs (either is fine
for what expects_func_args checks).

The reverts_task_state decorator can get a KeyError when checking
kwargs['instance'] and fail to revert the task_state on the instance,
which can leave us in a bad state where non-admins can't delete the
instance if the task_state is not None (and the reset-state API is
admin-only).

This fixes the KeyError in the decorator by normalizing the args/kwargs
list into a single dict that we can pull the instance from.

Also adds a warning log if we fail the instance update since it
shouldn't happen and we want to know if it does because of the
aforementioned problems with deleting orphaned instances.

There isn't a specific unit test added for this since moving
kwargs['instance'] above the try/except in reverts_task_state makes a
lot of tests fail already if you don't have the normalize code.

Closes-Bug: #1423952

Change-Id: I70f464120c798422f9a3d601b7cdf3b0a8320690

subject: Change testr to run in serial
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-12 13:27:15.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/run-tempest.sh', 'rpc_deployment/roles/tempest/files/rpc_tempest_gate.sh', 'scripts/gate-check-commit.sh'], 'message': "Change testr to run in serial

This change implements the change to allow testr to run in serial which
should resolve most issues with tempest on a resource constrained host.

The problem that is being resolved here is that testr will, by default,
run in multi-threaded and has a relitively high probability to result in
a 503. This primarily impacts the gate jobs as they are built on a hosts
with 4 CPUs and 8GB of ram.

By default if the tempest script is run, testr will run multi-threaded.
However, if the environment variable RUN_TEMPEST_OPTS is set to
'--serial' then it will run in serial. This is done for the
gate-check-commit script so that the change only affects the AIO gate
check.

An additional environment variable TESTR_OPTS is added for further
flexibility.

Conflicts:
        scripts/gate-check-commit.sh
        scripts/run-tempest.sh

The above conflicts were due to the difference between master and this
branch with regards to the environment variable. In master all variables
are exported. This difference will be addressed in a subsequent patch.

Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
Closes-Bug: #1428847
Change-Id: I8c7ac72ef46ae3f3af3d3503081bec0cbe7276e9
(cherry picked from commit 255b94d425c0e6bb6a78868b12e5ef1fb4346354)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Change testr to run in serial

This change implements the change to allow testr to run in serial which
should resolve most issues with tempest on a resource constrained host.

The problem that is being resolved here is that testr will, by default,
run in multi-threaded and has a relitively high probability to result in
a 503. This primarily impacts the gate jobs as they are built on a hosts
with 4 CPUs and 8GB of ram.

By default if the tempest script is run, testr will run multi-threaded.
However, if the environment variable RUN_TEMPEST_OPTS is set to
'--serial' then it will run in serial. This is done for the
gate-check-commit script so that the change only affects the AIO gate
check.

An additional environment variable TESTR_OPTS is added for further
flexibility.

Conflicts:
        scripts/gate-check-commit.sh
        scripts/run-tempest.sh

The above conflicts were due to the difference between master and this
branch with regards to the environment variable. In master all variables
are exported. This difference will be addressed in a subsequent patch.

Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
Closes-Bug: #1428847
Change-Id: I8c7ac72ef46ae3f3af3d3503081bec0cbe7276e9
(cherry picked from commit 255b94d425c0e6bb6a78868b12e5ef1fb4346354)

commit_message:
Set SSP name when no SSP configured

The 'ghost' Shared Storage Pool - the SSP we use if no SSP name is set
in the configuration file - was not showing its name in the nova logs.
Now it does.

Change-Id: I9b30ea393f4ce6ce0035ce907d194098764976db

commit_message:
Incorrect error message when VM deletion failed

Correct error message from "Failed to launch instance" to "Failed to perform
requested operation on instance, the instance has an error status" in file:
openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/tables.py.

Change-Id: Ieb3f8c83cd55a74b76cd442418a86c53180feed9
Closes-Bug: #1414164

commit_message:
Allow methods to be carried in Fernet tokens.

Previously, Fernet tokens assumed the authentication method in validation. This
change makes it so that methods is passed in the token as an integer and
reformatted on validation.

Closes-Bug: 1430062
Change-Id: I2e07dd18c303a1ed98770e8b6d484d9f41b04c3b

Federated token formatter

This commit introduces a Fernet token formatter for Federated tokens.

partially implements bp klw-tokens

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-06 23:17:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Refactor: make Fernet token creation/validation API agnostic

A lot of the Fernet token create / validate logic ended up in the v3
token provider methods, but there's nothing really API-specific about
it, so it should be moved somewhere such that it's available for use by
the v2 token provider code, which will just utilize a subset of the
available functionality (no domain scoped tokens, etc).

As a result of this change, everything about the implementation details
of Fernet tokens end up in the token_formatters module.

Change-Id: I6fe0fb581f156d14fc6be3772436cc03d909c4a6
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-03-09 16:38:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Refactor: make Fernet token creation/validation API agnostic

commit_message:
Refactor: make Fernet token creation/validation API agnostic

A lot of the Fernet token create / validate logic ended up in the v3
token provider methods, but there's nothing really API-specific about
it, so it should be moved somewhere such that it's available for use by
the v2 token provider code, which will just utilize a subset of the
available functionality (no domain scoped tokens, etc).

As a result of this change, everything about the implementation details
of Fernet tokens end up in the token_formatters module.

Change-Id: I6fe0fb581f156d14fc6be3772436cc03d909c4a6

commit_message:
Convert audit_ids to bytes

This will allow audit_ids to be converted to bytes before sending to msgpack.
This is important because it will help keep the token size down for Fernet
tokens.

partially implements bp klw-tokens
Change-Id: I6f356764ee2b4f22cca2b31d45449b2b8438870f

subject: Drop Fernet token prefixes & add domain-scoped Fernet tokens
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 2903, 'name': 'Morgan Fainberg', 'email': 'morgan.fainberg@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdrnstm'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 7725, 'name': 'David Stanek', 'email': 'dstanek@dstanek.com', 'username': 'dstanek'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9751, 'name': 'IBM DB2 CI', 'email': 'scecd@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibmdb2', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13152, 'name': 'Jorge Munoz', 'email': 'elkidster@gmail.com', 'username': 'jmunoz'}, {'_account_id': 13478, 'name': 'Boris Bobrov', 'email': 'b.bobrov@sap.com', 'username': 'bbobrov'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-06 06:26:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Drop Fernet token prefixes & add domain-scoped Fernet tokens

- Move the payload version (part of the plaintext token prefix) into the
  integrity verified portion of the token (the payload). This also drops
  the 'F', which doesn't serve a purpose with Fernet tokens as it does
  with token formats that can be validated offline (PKI, PKIZ). This
  requires a bunch of refactoring to move the responsibility of
  decrypting, unpacking, and disassembling the payload contents to the
  caller (the Provider).

- Add a domain-scoped payload format, identical to that for
  project-scoped tokens, just with a different version number. Better
  functional tests revealed that tests intended to exercise
  domain-scoped Fernet tokens, which didn't exist, should not have been
  passing.

- Remove remaining functional tests from the unit test suite
  (test_fernet_provider), and ensure that same coverage exists in the
  actual functional test suite (test_v3_auth). Several of the unit tests
  required heavy refactoring due to the refactoring required to support
  the first item above, so it was easier just to dump those tests in
  favor of better functional test coverage, which are agnostic to the
  implementation details.

Change-Id: I141f2707a391d46d9607710b30155b76de2f88f0
Closes-Bug: 1427485
Closes-Bug: 1428949

commit_message:
Drop Fernet token prefixes & add domain-scoped Fernet tokens

- Move the payload version (part of the plaintext token prefix) into the
  integrity verified portion of the token (the payload). This also drops
  the 'F', which doesn't serve a purpose with Fernet tokens as it does
  with token formats that can be validated offline (PKI, PKIZ). This
  requires a bunch of refactoring to move the responsibility of
  decrypting, unpacking, and disassembling the payload contents to the
  caller (the Provider).

- Add a domain-scoped payload format, identical to that for
  project-scoped tokens, just with a different version number. Better
  functional tests revealed that tests intended to exercise
  domain-scoped Fernet tokens, which didn't exist, should not have been
  passing.

- Remove remaining functional tests from the unit test suite
  (test_fernet_provider), and ensure that same coverage exists in the
  actual functional test suite (test_v3_auth). Several of the unit tests
  required heavy refactoring due to the refactoring required to support
  the first item above, so it was easier just to dump those tests in
  favor of better functional test coverage, which are agnostic to the
  implementation details.

Change-Id: I141f2707a391d46d9607710b30155b76de2f88f0
Closes-Bug: 1427485
Closes-Bug: 1428949

commit_message:
VMware: Deprecation warning - map one nova-compute to one VC cluster

So earlier in the cycle, Ifc17c5049e3ed29c8dd130339207907b00433960 was
filed to entirely remove support for multiple clusters in a single
compute node. We are probably late in the cycle now to make that
move. So a a minimum, let's throw a deprecation warning in the logs
and add Documentation that we prefer everyone to use one nova-compute
per cluster going forward in Liberty.

Change-Id: I0d6b5402b11cfe162a5dcbcaeecd5b40be114c3c

commit_message:
Skip boto tests when auth_version is v3

When auth_version is v3, boto clients are not setup by manager
as boto clients can only use v2 identity clients to generate AWS
credentials.

When auth version is v3, boto tests try to run, and fail because
they can't find the clients. They should be skipped instead.

Partially-implements: bp/multi-keystone-api-version-tests
Change-Id: I7281d2c886d123682cefc5b5511c11300af0ca4c

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-10 21:08:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Enable offline compression for resource files

The default value for OFFLINE_COMPRESS is False, as per the Django
compressor docs. When using offline compression, it seems that different
request contexts may generate different CSS files with different names
by way of the SCSS generator. When the HTML is returned to the browser,
the CSS filename referenced will only exist on the node that received
the initial request and generated the CSS file locally, however in a
load-balanced scenario with multiple Horizon instances, the actual HTTP
request for the CSS file has a n-1/n chance of hitting another node that
may be lacking that file, resulting in an unstyled page.

Changing the OFFLINE_COMPRESS value to True enables Django to use the
pre-generated list of resources -- created via the manage.py compress
command -- which is stored in a manifest.json file and should be the
same name/content across the instances since it's not varying by request
context like during online compression.

Change-Id: Iccb9b8cd30b7a61435f9ccc813c4032a24cbe52a

commit_message:
Enable offline compression for resource files

The default value for OFFLINE_COMPRESS is False, as per the Django
compressor docs. When using offline compression, it seems that different
request contexts may generate different CSS files with different names
by way of the SCSS generator. When the HTML is returned to the browser,
the CSS filename referenced will only exist on the node that received
the initial request and generated the CSS file locally, however in a
load-balanced scenario with multiple Horizon instances, the actual HTTP
request for the CSS file has a n-1/n chance of hitting another node that
may be lacking that file, resulting in an unstyled page.

Changing the OFFLINE_COMPRESS value to True enables Django to use the
pre-generated list of resources -- created via the manage.py compress
command -- which is stored in a manifest.json file and should be the
same name/content across the instances since it's not varying by request
context like during online compression.

Change-Id: Iccb9b8cd30b7a61435f9ccc813c4032a24cbe52a
Closes-Bug: #1423783

commit_message:
Bump tempest sha

Going from tempest tag 3 to tempest sha 7c73dd5 in 49cfbb2 resulted in
the following smoke tests failing:

AccountQuotasNegativeTest.test_user_modify_quota
ObjectACLsNegativeTest.test_delete_object_without_write_rights
ObjectACLsNegativeTest.test_read_object_without_rights
ObjectACLsNegativeTest.test_write_object_without_rights
ObjectACLsNegativeTest.test_write_object_without_write_rights

This issue is worked around in tempest commit b8c2d7c (merge commit
17f81d4).

Change-Id: I2df65e6656ed65cc3a50c46ac4f9a1da1b43db48
Closes-Bug: #1431052

subject: Don't mock argparse
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-12 01:11:38.000000000', 'files': ['bashate/bashate.py', 'bashate/tests/test_bashate.py'], 'message': 'Don't mock argparse

If you mock argparse, then something like 'opts.show' that should be
simply True/False becomes a mocked method.  Therefore perfectly fine
code like "if opts.show:" starts to fail as it is no longer boolean.
This should just wrap sys.argv

Change-Id: I536aabf639647146edcdc7536a49b7524103cd87
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Don't mock argparse

If you mock argparse, then something like 'opts.show' that should be
simply True/False becomes a mocked method.  Therefore perfectly fine
code like "if opts.show:" starts to fail as it is no longer boolean.
This should just wrap sys.argv

Change-Id: I536aabf639647146edcdc7536a49b7524103cd87

[{'created': '2015-03-11 19:36:39.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/datera.py'], 'message': "Unset auth token before trying to login to Datera

After a token expires, the Datera driver would try to login, and pass
along the expired token. This would fail because the receiving server
will authorize anytime it's given an auth token, even for endpoints that
don't require it. This change unsets the auth token when logging in, so
it's not passed a long.

Closes-Bug: #1430978
Change-Id: Id445718e3e73b676e3af8005b8fdd1a028ef2b0e
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Unset auth token before trying to login to Datera

After a token expires, the Datera driver would try to login, and pass
along the expired token. This would fail because the receiving server
will authorize anytime it's given an auth token, even for endpoints that
don't require it. This change unsets the auth token when logging in, so
it's not passed a long.

Closes-Bug: #1430978
Change-Id: Id445718e3e73b676e3af8005b8fdd1a028ef2b0e

commit_message:
Migrations squash

SQL Migrations for Kilo require the schema version to be at 044
which is the final verison for the Icehouse release. This limits the
change sets that could affect assumptions made in earlier migration
files. Migrating to before the Icehouse release migration is no longer
supported.

Implements: blueprint kilo-sql-squash

Change-Id: I65c48f1dc336cef14a365e37dc4084a4abc6ee51

commit_message:
zuul-swift-upload fix delete-after

The delete after param is passed as part of the payload, not a
header when use the formpost middleware.

commit_message:
Ironic: uefi localboot support

This commit adds support for uefi localboot in
deploy-ironic element. The change is to mount the efi
system partition (created by Ironic) in /boot/efi.

The corresponding Ironic change is
I00ac31da325676ea4ea1ac4185f5ac3a52c5809a

Implements: blueprint local-boot-support-with-partition-images
Change-Id: Idf7ac5987e14e1d31311834196ca7283deec15c6

installing elasticsearch

subject: Fix check for installtype
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-11 00:11:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix check for installtype

Previously, this code was not checking for the proper environment
variable for an element's installtype. There was a line replacing '-'
with '_' as is required, but that value was not actually used when
searching for the environment variable.

Change-Id: I0bbd56969188389db81844d9276269464870f776
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-03-11 01:59:09.000000000', 'files': ['elements/package-installs/bin/package-installs-squash'], 'message': "Fix check for installtype

Previously, this code was not checking for the proper environment
variable for an element's installtype. There was a line replacing '-'
with '_' as is required, but that value was not actually used when
searching for the environment variable.

Change-Id: I0bbd56969188389db81844d9276269464870f776
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fix check for installtype

Previously, this code was not checking for the proper environment
variable for an element's installtype. There was a line replacing '-'
with '_' as is required, but that value was not actually used when
searching for the environment variable.

Change-Id: I0bbd56969188389db81844d9276269464870f776

commit_message:
fsync() on directories

renamer() method now does a fsync on containing directory of target path
and also on parent dirs of newly created directories, by default.
This can be explicitly turned off in cases where it is not
necessary (For example- quarantines).

The following article explains why this is necessary:
http://lwn.net/Articles/457667/

Although, it may seem like the right thing to do, this change does come
at a performance penalty. However, no configurable option is provided to
turn it off.

Also, lock_path() inside invalidate_hash() was always creating part of
object path in filesystem. Those are never fsync'd. This has been
fixed.

Change-Id: Id8e02f84f48370edda7fb0c46e030db3b53a71e3
Signed-off-by: Prashanth Pai <ppai@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add JSON schema validation for service providers

This patch adds a JSON schema to validate service provider objects.
In the schema, the auth_url and sp_url fields are set as required to
avoid creating or updating service providers without such fields.

Change-Id: I98ad62762ce2416f08ba8280425e0cb2815f0996
Partial-Bug: 1431377

blueprint spec (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/130858).

chunked backup driver.  It should be straightforward to abstract out

backup driver itself.

commit_message:
NFS backup driver

Implements an NFS backup service in accord with the NFS backup driver
blueprint spec (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/130858).

Currently the NFS backup driver inherits directly from the abstract
chunked backup driver.  It should be straightforward to abstract out
of this code a posix filesystem backup driver, without dynamic mount
capabilities, which itself inherits from the chunked backup driver.
When that is done, most of the code in this implementation can be
removed and it can be modified to inherit from the posix filesystem
backup driver itself.

Implements: blueprint nfs-backup

Change-Id: I01ce30c25e7239e68cc7c70038f4f880218cb66a

commit_message:
Syntax enhancements

Did some syntax improvement by:
-Removing extraneous parentheses.
-Collapsing "if" statements.
-Used set literal notation.
-Fixed pep8 issue

Change-Id: I321536058a76bf69af1d6b38d37f81a07a2f7108
Closes-Bug: #1397027

commit_message:
Add scenario 'test_preserve_preexisting_port'

When a server is created with a neutron port specified, the port
shouldn't be deleted when the server is deleted, it should be updated to
be 'unbound' from the server but still exist in neutron.

Depends-On: Ia5367cf064d40690670ffeac3c1f16998464c234

Related-Bug: #1158684

Change-Id: Ia9b09eb8430f2bef39db64b702b9faed1042396b

Instead of killing the screen, use stop_process which will

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Shut down ironic services in the modern way

Instead of killing the screen, use stop_process which will
shut the processes when USE_SCREEN is False.

Change-Id: If0f714cb112dbf5fe9e4fdd7291cb4fb1df87f42

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-27 23:01:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Don't start transaction during floating IP delete

The previous floating IP code was starting a transaction to
delete the floating IP object from the database and then
calling the core plugin's delete_port method which could make
many yielding calls, risking deadlocks.

This patch updates the relationship between floating IP and the
ports table to allow the port deletion to automatically clear
the floating IP object via a cascade.

Change-Id: I4b1cdc198c18d5c673a35aaf9c7e960f97f1e20b
Closes-Bug: #1426482
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-02-28 00:23:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Don't start transaction during floating IP delete

The previous floating IP code was starting a transaction to
delete the floating IP object from the database and then
calling the core plugin's delete_port method which could make
many yielding calls, risking deadlocks.

This patch updates the relationship between floating IP and the
ports table to allow the port deletion to automatically clear
the floating IP object via a cascade.

Change-Id: I4b1cdc198c18d5c673a35aaf9c7e960f97f1e20b
Closes-Bug: #1426482
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-02-28 00:25:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Don't start transaction during floating IP delete

The previous floating IP code was starting a transaction to
delete the floating IP object from the database and then
calling the core plugin's delete_port method which could make
many yielding calls, risking deadlocks.

This patch updates the relationship between floating IP and the
ports table to allow the port deletion to automatically clear
the floating IP object via a cascade.

", 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-03-01 07:09:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Bring back port removal from ovsdb after its deletion

Change Iccda3bee98d561ef3a06d0317d3d68d6b1dfb76b's side-effect
was to increase a race window that caused DBDealock timeouts,
and for this reason, it was reverted.

This change brings the patch back, but it also tweak the logic
around floating ip removal so that we don't have to start a
transaction during floating IP delete operation.

In fact, the existing logic  was starting a transaction to
delete the floating IP object from the database and then
calling the core plugin's delete_port method which could make
many yielding calls, risking deadlocks.

This patch updates the relationship between floating IP and the
ports table to allow the port deletion to automatically clear
the floating IP object via a cascade.

Closes-Bug: #1426543
Closes-Bug: #1426482
Related-Bud: #1333365

Change-Id: I4b1cdc198c18d5c673a35aaf9c7e960f97f1e20b
", 'number': 4}, {'created': '2015-03-01 08:24:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Close FLIP del txact before port del txact

The previous floating IP code was starting a transaction to
delete the floating IP object from the database and then
calling the core plugin's delete_port method which could make
many yielding calls, risking deadlocks.

In addition to introducing deadlock risks, it was changing
the behavior of rollbacks for the ML2 plugin. Normally, a failure
in the ML2 delete_port code during the post-commit phase cannot
bring back a port because the DB change should have been committed.
However, in this case the port would be restored in the event of
an uncaught exception because of the transaction started by the
floating IP deletion code. This can lead to inconsitency since
backends may think the port has been deleted when it was actually
restored by the floating IP transaction rollback.

This patch separates the floating IP deletion into its own
transaction. The potential downside to this approach is that
a failure to delete the corresponding port will no longer rollback
the deletion of the floating IP. However, trying to make both
operations atomic was a losing proposition when they can both result
in remote calls to completely different backends.

Closes-Bug: #1426543
Closes-Bug: #1426482
Change-Id: I4b1cdc198c18d5c673a35aaf9c7e960f97f1e20b
", 'number': 5}, {'created': '2015-03-01 10:00:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Close FLIP delete transaction before port del

The previous floating IP code was starting a transaction to
delete the floating IP object from the database and then
calling the core plugin's delete_port method which could make
many yielding calls, risking deadlocks.

In addition to introducing deadlock risks, it was changing
the behavior of rollbacks for the ML2 plugin. Normally, a failure
in the ML2 delete_port code during the post-commit phase cannot
bring back a port because the DB change should have been committed.
However, in this case the port would be restored in the event of
an uncaught exception because of the transaction started by the
floating IP deletion code. This can lead to inconsitency because
backends may think the port has been deleted when it was actually
restored by the floating IP transaction rollback.

This patch separates the floating IP deletion into its own
transaction. In the event that the port deletion fails, the floating
IP record will be re-added back to the database to simulate the
rollback semantics from before.

There will now be a narrow window where a loss of connectivity to the
database could result in the floating IP record being deleted while
its corresponding port remains. In this case, an admin will have to
manually delete the port.

Closes-Bug: #1426543
Closes-Bug: #1426482
Change-Id: I4b1cdc198c18d5c673a35aaf9c7e960f97f1e20b

commit_message:
Don't start transaction during floating IP delete

The previous floating IP code was starting a transaction to
delete the floating IP object from the database and then
calling the core plugin's delete_port method which could make
many yielding calls, risking deadlocks.

This patch updates the relationship between floating IP and the
ports table to allow the port deletion to automatically clear
the floating IP object via a cascade.

Closes-Bug: #1426543
Closes-Bug: #1426482
Change-Id: I4b1cdc198c18d5c673a35aaf9c7e960f97f1e20b

subject: Get the ID of a single sub-resource
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-12 02:23:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Get the ID of a single resource

We currently have the ability to loop through all attributes on a
resource and get values which are safe to send in a request body, such
as converting the IDs of subresources. However, it would be helpful in
several cases to be able to get the ID of just one specific attribute
when overriding Resource methods. A lot of the Resources that have paths
like /images/%(image_id)/tag that need an override also need to get the
ID of the image.Image that it's set as.

Change-Id: I8d2c79ebaceb4135ab605510d009432d7d5307f3
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-03-12 02:28:03.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/resource.py'], 'message': "Get the ID of a single sub-resource

We currently have the ability to loop through all attributes on a
resource and get values which are safe to send in a request body, such
as converting the IDs of subresources. However, it would be helpful in
several cases to be able to get the ID of just one specific attribute
when overriding Resource methods. A lot of the Resources that have paths
like /images/%(image_id)/tag that need an override also need to get the
ID of the image.Image that it's set as.

Change-Id: I8d2c79ebaceb4135ab605510d009432d7d5307f3
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Get the ID of a single sub-resource

We currently have the ability to loop through all attributes on a
resource and get values which are safe to send in a request body, such
as converting the IDs of subresources. However, it would be helpful in
several cases to be able to get the ID of just one specific attribute
when overriding Resource methods. A lot of the Resources that have paths
like /images/%(image_id)/tag that need an override also need to get the
ID of the image.Image that it's set as.

Change-Id: I8d2c79ebaceb4135ab605510d009432d7d5307f3

commit_message:
Ensure get-pip.py is retrieved properly

Without force: "yes" the get_url module will only retrieve the file if
the destination doesn't exist. This causes issues if, for example, the
get-pip.py exists but is empty (due to an issue), or if the get-pip.py
is updated at some point.

Change-Id: I9d6933c837e0e38d51dfb57a3eddd1ca461e0723
Closes-Bug: #1429165

subject: Revert "Build wheel house during nodepool devstack caching"
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-13 00:07:50.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/elements/cache-devstack/install.d/98-build-wheelhouse', 'nodepool/scripts/cache_devstack.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Build wheel house during nodepool devstack caching"

This reverts commit 1f84dbb2ce2ae7ed50401299db499adb6e836ec0.

Reverting because this runs a significant portion of devstack during
image builds installing packages necessary to build the wheels. Instead
we should be building wheels and hosting them on our mirror. Then image
builds and jobs themselves can both use this mirror to either cache
wheels or install wheels.

Conflicts:
	nodepool/scripts/cache_devstack.py

Change-Id: I70ebc57076845995c539a42e4f87e241569211b4
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Revert "Build wheel house during nodepool devstack caching"

This reverts commit 1f84dbb2ce2ae7ed50401299db499adb6e836ec0.

Reverting because this runs a significant portion of devstack during
image builds installing packages necessary to build the wheels. Instead
we should be building wheels and hosting them on our mirror. Then image
builds and jobs themselves can both use this mirror to either cache
wheels or install wheels.

Conflicts:
	nodepool/scripts/cache_devstack.py

Change-Id: I70ebc57076845995c539a42e4f87e241569211b4

[{'created': '2014-11-20 16:19:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Correct such logic in store.get() when chunk_size param provided

The change corrected the logic of image content reading function in
get() for some store drivers. if the chunk_size param provided from
outside, it means client want to read partial image content from
storage, current implementation is incomplete and has some problem.

The change didn't try to make drivers fully support random access from
backend with chunk_size (and offset) param, that stuff will be
implementated by a dedicated patch, this one only to make default logic
be correct.

commit_message:
Correct such logic in store.get() when chunk_size param provided

The change corrected the logic of image content reading function in
get() for some store drivers. if the chunk_size param provided from
outside, it means client want to read partial image content from
storage, current implementation is incomplete and has some problem.

The change didn't try to make drivers fully support random access from
backend with chunk_size (and offset) param, that stuff will be
implementated by a dedicated patch, this one only to make default logic
be correct.

Change-Id: I76fd3746a2c449e257ea2a19c2dc6118be207eec
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Remove incubative openstack.common.context module

glance_store library needn't to use openstack.common.context
module really, the only relevancy is swift store unit test, which
would be better to use mock instead however.

The patch changed swift store unit test to use mock easily,
and removed glance_store.openstack namespace due to context
module is the last one incubative module synced from oslo-inc.
We might use graduated oslo library in future neatly and hopefully.

Change-Id: I4442735e4f4350eb01dfd49f4cf8b12a141ce0f7
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

This is a continuation of

The same issue cropped up for me in
test_create_consistencygroup_from_src().

Add some more specific asserts to try to reveal what
is going wrong here.  The idea is to assert more
specific things (examining individual notifications)
before more general asserts (count of notifications) when
possible, to fail the test on the check that will provide
the most information back.

commit_message:
Tests: Harden fake_notifier asserts

This is a continuation of
8740e063 - Make test_create_delete_snapshot more robust

The same issue cropped up for me in
test_create_consistencygroup_from_src().

Add some more specific asserts to try to reveal what
is going wrong here.  The idea is to assert more
specific things (examining individual notifications)
before more general asserts (count of notifications) when
possible, to fail the test on the check that will provide
the most information back.

Related-Bug: #1412513

Change-Id: I267bd5933247f69f220a7be871a63e4db9eb9a80

commit_message:
Retain nested causes where/when we can

On py3.x we should attempt to retain an exceptions
causes (if any) so that they can be examined at a later
time. This adds that change into gather and retain this
information via a new failure causes property (that is
lazily populated).

This will aid in the change to traceback2 and the
adjustments made in http://bugs.python.org/issue17911 so
that we can in the future use its exception class instead.

Change-Id: I8cadd7b70c2f638719155d96df4236fc40e18ccf

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-01 12:32:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Use oslo_config.cfg.ConfigOpts in glance_store

Move from oslo.config to oslo_config. This change could prevent glance
failed by "NoSuchOptError: no such option: glance_store" triggered in
verify_default_store() error when startup [0].

The root cause is that when we import oslo.config.cfg (when importing
glance_store in glance context) first than oslo_config.cfg, global
oslo.config.cfg.ConfigOpts object (CONF) in glance_store code is a
different object (and type) than oslo_config.cfg.ConfigOpts object in
glance code, so register_opts() of glance_store registered all store
needed options to a separated ConfigOpts object but glance used one.

With change I30ecbf8f9de77496fcb643c7ad9738d79ad359f0) glance is using
oslo_config namespace now, so before release new glance_store, we need
merge this change in.

A clear and simpler example as following:

Python 2.7.6 (default, Mar 22 2014, 22:59:56) 
>>> from glance_store import backend
>>> from glance.common import config  # we do this importing order for
pep8 required in now code.
>>> config.CONF == backend.CONF, config.CONF, backend.CONF
(False, <oslo_config.cfg.ConfigOpts object at 0x7f4e4cd18690>,
<oslo.config.cfg.ConfigOpts object at 0x7f4e4e521d50>)
# Renew python session.
>>> from glance.common import config
>>> from glance_store import backend
>>> config.CONF == backend.CONF, config.CONF, backend.CONF
(True, <oslo_config.cfg.ConfigOpts object at 0x7fc355937450>,
<oslo_config.cfg.ConfigOpts object at 0x7fc355937450>)

Change-Id: I1f1962c462b0c1fcdce0c04c6a1cec57d9f191eb
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-03-01 16:35:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Use oslo_config.cfg.ConfigOpts in glance_store

glance code, so register_opts() of glance_store registered all store
needed options to a separated ConfigOpts object but glance used one.

With change I30ecbf8f9de77496fcb643c7ad9738d79ad359f0) glance is using
oslo_config namespace now, so before release new glance_store, we need
merge this change in.

A clear and simpler example as following:

Python 2.7.6 (default, Mar 22 2014, 22:59:56) 
>>> from glance_store import backend
>>> from glance.common import config  # we do this importing order for
pep8 required in now code.
>>> config.CONF == backend.CONF, config.CONF, backend.CONF
(False, <oslo_config.cfg.ConfigOpts object at 0x7f4e4cd18690>,
<oslo.config.cfg.ConfigOpts object at 0x7f4e4e521d50>)
# Renew python session.
>>> from glance.common import config
>>> from glance_store import backend
>>> config.CONF == backend.CONF, config.CONF, backend.CONF
(True, <oslo_config.cfg.ConfigOpts object at 0x7fc355937450>,
<oslo_config.cfg.ConfigOpts object at 0x7fc355937450>)

commit_message:
Use oslo_config.cfg.ConfigOpts in glance_store

Move from oslo.config to oslo_config. This change could prevent glance
failed by "NoSuchOptError: no such option: glance_store" triggered in
verify_default_store() error when startup [0].

The root cause is that when we import oslo.config.cfg (when importing
glance_store in glance context) first than oslo_config.cfg, global
oslo.config.cfg.ConfigOpts object (CONF) in glance_store code is a
different object (and type) than oslo_config.cfg.ConfigOpts object in
glance code, so register_opts() of glance_store registered all store
needed options to a separated ConfigOpts object but glance used one.

With change I30ecbf8f9de77496fcb643c7ad9738d79ad359f0) glance is using
oslo_config namespace now, so before release new glance_store, we need
merge this change in.

A clear and simpler example as following:

Python 2.7.6 (default, Mar 22 2014, 22:59:56) 
>>> from glance_store import backend
>>> from glance.common import config  # we do this importing order for
pep8 required in now code.
>>> config.CONF == backend.CONF, config.CONF, backend.CONF
(False, <oslo_config.cfg.ConfigOpts object at 0x7f4e4cd18690>,
<oslo.config.cfg.ConfigOpts object at 0x7f4e4e521d50>)
# Renew python session.
>>> from glance.common import config
>>> from glance_store import backend
>>> config.CONF == backend.CONF, config.CONF, backend.CONF
(True, <oslo_config.cfg.ConfigOpts object at 0x7fc355937450>,
<oslo_config.cfg.ConfigOpts object at 0x7fc355937450>)

Change-Id: I1f1962c462b0c1fcdce0c04c6a1cec57d9f191eb
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Improvements to forge uploading process

This externally sets the Rakefile, preventing any nastiness from someone
trying to overwrite it. This also uses jq to modify version to be set
to the ZUUL_REF environment variable, which in this context is the name
of the tag.

Change-Id: Ia2e23f277373912bebcbe707d771ac989be57c5e

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-11 19:35:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "neutron: deprecate 'allow_duplicate_networks' config option

Commit 322cc9336fe6f6fe9b3f0da33c6b26a3e5ea9b0c added the option for
blueprint multiple-if-1-net back in Juno but it doesn't really make
sense to have a config option for this.

Having multiple ports on the same network associated with the same
instance is supported in Neutron, but Nova wasn't handling it before the
change, which was arguably a bug fix.  With the default of False, we
have basically a feature disabled by default which could result in bug
reports if someone didn't know this was not supported unless you flip
the switch.

We should deprecate the config option in Kilo and remove it in Liberty.
When we remove it, we should change the default behavior to act as if
allow_duplicate_networks=True so the feature just works out of the box.

Change-Id: Ideeb3c137ff68a4497189670be33f6edbb0ccb76
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-03-11 19:40:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "neutron: deprecate 'allow_duplicate_networks' config option

change, which was arguably a bug fix.  With the default of False, we
have basically a feature disabled by default which could result in bug
reports if someone didn't know this was not supported unless you flip
the switch.

We should deprecate the config option in Kilo and remove it in Liberty.
When we remove it, we should change the default behavior to act as if
allow_duplicate_networks=True so the feature just works out of the box.

DocImpact: The neutron.allow_duplicate_networks config option is
           deprecated in Kilo and will be removed in Liberty where
           the default behavior will be to just allow multiple ports

commit_message:
neutron: deprecate 'allow_duplicate_networks' config option

Commit 322cc9336fe6f6fe9b3f0da33c6b26a3e5ea9b0c added the option for
blueprint multiple-if-1-net back in Juno but it doesn't really make
sense to have a config option for this.

Having multiple ports on the same network associated with the same
instance is supported in Neutron, but Nova wasn't handling it before the
change, which was arguably a bug fix.  With the default of False, we
have basically a feature disabled by default which could result in bug
reports if someone didn't know this was not supported unless you flip
the switch.

We should deprecate the config option in Kilo and remove it in Liberty.
When we remove it, we should change the default behavior to act as if
allow_duplicate_networks=True so the feature just works out of the box.

DocImpact: The neutron.allow_duplicate_networks config option is
           deprecated in Kilo and will be removed in Liberty where
           the default behavior will be to just allow multiple ports
           attached to an instance on the same network in Neutron.

Change-Id: Ideeb3c137ff68a4497189670be33f6edbb0ccb76

commit_message:
Add RAID configuration methods in decom extension

This commit is to add create_raid_configuration and
delete_raid_configuration as part of decom extension.
The calls are directly dispatched to hardware manager
so that different vendors can implement their own methods.

Co-Authored-By: Ramakrishnan G <rameshg87@gmail.com>
Implements: blueprint inband-raid-configuration
Change-Id: Ie27fa281626997081bdba2345fc75b9eb91dc973

commit_message:
Ignore missing packages

There are some cases where packages (or its dependencies) are missing.
Cache them on a best-effort basis, and ignore any that are missing.
They will be downloaded and installed if and when they are needed.

Change-Id: I5cd7f5f35b4fef6002c6cc3d66543a33a6972ef8

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-09 15:46:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Glance-manage db_export_metadefs generate inappropriate json files

Json files generated in metadata seeding using "glance-manage
db_export_metadefs" are inappropriate. Attribute 'owner' for namespace is
useless and shouldn't be generated.

Object related to resource_type_associations after exporting to json has
a not necessary (useless) attribute 'protected'. Database record in
metadef_namespace_resource_types doesn't have attribute 'proteced'.

Other issue related to this bug are 'prefix' and 'properties_target'
attributes. They should be generated for resource_type_associations
in json file but they aren't.

Change-Id: I1d5077485aa86cd63fed3aa852f633d5c95e89ad
Closes-Bug: #1377947

commit_message:
db_export_metadefs generates inappropriate json files

Json files generated in metadata seeding using "glance-manage
db_export_metadefs" are inappropriate. Attribute 'owner' for namespace
is useless and shouldn't be generated.

Object related to resource_type_associations after exporting to json has
a not necessary (useless) attribute 'protected'. Database record in
metadef_namespace_resource_types doesn't have attribute 'proteced'.

Other issue related to this bug are 'prefix' and 'properties_target'
attributes. They should be generated for resource_type_associations
in json file but they aren't.

Change-Id: I1d5077485aa86cd63fed3aa852f633d5c95e89ad
Closes-Bug: #1377947

commit_message:
cancel next previous buttons are aligned properly

In create network form, the buttons in the footer are
not aligned properly, the image is attached in the bug report.
Each buttons are inserted in separate div blocks, this is causing
the misaligned view. now everything is put it in a single div and
it is aligned in a single row.
Change-Id: I6df8524865483dc8ea259f555a56a4a773dabdbf
Closes-Bug: #1379931

commit_message:
Transform sample_cnt type to int

Duration is seconds from current time, and sample_cnt on
the basis of duration. So sample_cnt always not a int, but
we need sample_cnt as a int type.

Closes-Bug:#1330330

Change-Id: I89e1768523384e24c3a0b8b76f4fa04a123248f9
(cherry picked from commit 2866266a5448b7c49ca8988f82f22b25192e6e16)

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-25 13:56:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Basic support for image conversion

This patch adds a task for image conversion. It uses `qemu-img` to
convert images. This tool has support for several image formats.

The current implementation converts images iff the operator has
configured glance to do so. That is, the `convert_to_format` option has
been set.

There are few things about this patch that should be improved by
follow-up patches. The first one is the fact that it relies on the
entry_points order for task execution. Although this works, it is not
the most flexible/controllable way to do it. The second thing is that it
relies on the aforementioned configuration option to enable/disable the
task (as in, it becomes a non-op). There should be an explicit way to
enable/disable tasks.

Since both things mentioned in the previous paragraph affect the task
management in general, I've decided to let the fix for a follow-up
patch.

DocImpact

Partially-implements blueprint: new-upload-workflow
Partially-implements blueprint: basic-import-conversion

commit_message:
Basic support for image conversion

This patch adds a task for image conversion. It uses `qemu-img` to
convert images. This tool has support for several image formats.

The current implementation converts images if and only if the operator
has configured glance to do so. That is, the `convert_to_format` option
has been set.

There are few things about this patch that should be improved by
follow-up patches. The first one is the fact that it relies on the
entry_points order for task execution. Although this works, it is not
the most flexible/controllable way to do it. The second thing is that it
relies on the aforementioned configuration option to enable/disable the
task (as in, it becomes a non-op). There should be an explicit way to
enable/disable tasks.

Since both things mentioned in the previous paragraph affect the task
management in general, I've decided to leave the fix for a follow-up
patch.

DocImpact
SecurityImpact

Partially-implements blueprint: new-upload-workflow
Partially-implements blueprint: basic-import-conversion

commit_message:
Implements whitelist and blacklist mapping rules

Adds whitelist and blacklist rules to allow passing through a list of
groups from the IdP, after filtering them according to either of these
rules.

Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Duarte Sousa <rodrigods@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Marek Denis <marek.denis@cern.ch>
Co-Authored-By: David Stanek <dstanek@dstanek.com>
Partially-Implements: bp mapping-enhancements
Change-Id: I4592ba1c05e99c16645b5303c0192fc462b474aa

commit_message:
DB changes for resource locking

This patch adds engine_id and atomic_key column to the resource
table for locking the resource and making all operations atomic.
Also added the db api to update the resource table.

The engine which updates the db first, gets the lock on the
resource. Only updates with this engine are possible. Updates with
other engine will not go through as they will fail to find the
matching record in the db.

Change-Id: Id8c3df7a439347652d3feca7481cd72762bf30ea
Implements: blueprint convergence-resource-locking

commit_message:
Bump rtslib version to have config persistence

On version 2.1.41 method save_to_file was added and it is now need to
persist iSCSI lio configuration.

Change-Id: I0cac2ebb709089181b237fe6df94a44a30be716e
Related-Bug: #1427301

subject: Add missing servers.create parameter documentation
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-12 18:19:47.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v2/servers.py'], 'message': "Add missing servers.create parameter documentation

The min_count, max_count, and security_groups parameters for
servers.create are missing documentation. The security_groups
parameter was documented in the servers._boot function but that
private function isn't published to the docs.

This change adds the missing documentation for the aforementioned
parameters and removes the duplicate docs in the servers._boot
function.

Change-Id: Ib0dcc7e8f7f4d0b83b6caeddd1ace66add4e0003
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add missing servers.create parameter documentation

The min_count, max_count, and security_groups parameters for
servers.create are missing documentation. The security_groups
parameter was documented in the servers._boot function but that
private function isn't published to the docs.

This change adds the missing documentation for the aforementioned
parameters and removes the duplicate docs in the servers._boot
function.

Change-Id: Ib0dcc7e8f7f4d0b83b6caeddd1ace66add4e0003

commit_message:
Fixes alignment of pencil icon in Users Table

When cell is empty (e.g. in the email column), the edit pencil icon gets
shifted down and not centered. This patch makes the pencil icon centered
for all the cases.

Change-Id: I5a344449e496e73f2a0679a6206e4c35747afb0f

commit_message:
Adding utf8 to federation tables

Tables have to be in utf8 for the migration utility
to work properly. This fixes the UTF8 issues with the
federation tables in-line and should be able to be
backported. A subsequent change to handle sanity checks
in a more sane way (post migrations) will be implemented
going forward.

Change-Id: Id68c3f307f53b6a4de011e2608d899d044aced68
Closes-Bug: 1426334

commit_message:
Refactor '_get_default_network' method in the integration tests

Refactored '_get_default_network' to get any network by its name,
othewise it was impossible to get 'public' net.

Change-Id: Ie691f99961a28e47f7437f3e52be9baf2984e839

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-26 23:02:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add multiattach capabilities injection

This patch is a follow up to the multiattach patch that adds
the ability to the scheduler to be able to filter capabilities
on the volume multiattach flag.   When a volume creation request
comes in with the multiattach flag set on a volume, there was no
way to filter out backends that don't support attaching a volume
to more than one host.   By defaut, no host supports it.  When
The Nova side lands, we can adjust drivers to add the new
multiattach:True capability reporting.

Change-Id: Ia426a2bf2ab8214f52fb6e70a3a1deff68d13d98
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-02-27 17:39:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add multiattach capabilities injection

commit_message:
Add multiattach capabilities injection

This patch is a follow up to the multiattach patch that adds
the ability to the scheduler to be able to filter capabilities
on the volume multiattach flag.   When a volume creation request
comes in with the multiattach flag set on a volume, there was no
way to filter out backends that don't support attaching a volume
to more than one host.   By defaut, no host supports it.  When
The Nova side lands, we can adjust drivers to add the new
multiattach:True capability reporting.

Change-Id: Ia426a2bf2ab8214f52fb6e70a3a1deff68d13d98

commit_message:
Add InstanceList.get_all method

As part of the effort to remove direct DB calls from the Scheduler
filters, there needs to be a method for getting an InstanceList object
containing all the instances available.

Partially-Implements: blueprint isolate-scheduler-db
(https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/isolate-scheduler-db)

Change-Id: Ie5e0e4f2dbb46da5df91067cfe90de366fc9adc9

", 'number': 7}, {'created': '2015-03-12 05:20:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Create DIB elements for HP Vertica on Ubuntu

A specification for this change was submitted for review in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/151126/

Changes:
- Create the disk-image-builder elements for
  installing HP Vertica on Ubuntu.

- Introduces new env variables:
  - DS_WITH_MANUAL_PACKAGE: Signifies that the datastores
    in this list need a manually downloaded package file.
  - DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION: Specifies location to look for
    package installer file for datastores in
    DS_WITH_MANUAL_PACKAGE list, which by-default would look
    in a pkgs directory in user's home.

- If a datastore is listed in DS_WITH_MANUAL_PACKAGE and
  package file does not exists at DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION then
  kick-start would error out by informing
  "Datastore package file not found! Download package file
  for datastore: <DATASTORE_NAME>"

- To execute kick-start for Vertica, user has to download
  Vertica package from https://my.vertica.com and place
  the file at DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION.

Partially Implements: blueprint vertica-db-support

Change-Id: Ibc64b42eb5d2f4722eb27a7bc730dda98014347f

    DS_WITH_MANUAL_PACKAGE list, which by-default would look

- If a datastore is listed in DS_WITH_MANUAL_PACKAGE and

  kick-start would error out by informing

', 'number': 9}, {'created': '2015-03-12 08:18:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Create DIB elements for HP Vertica on Ubuntu

A specification for this change was submitted for review in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/151126/

Changes:
- Creates the disk-image-builder elements for
  installing HP Vertica on Ubuntu.

- Introduces new env variables DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION which
  specifies location to look for package installer file.

- It would be the job of elements(extra-data.d) to discover
  existence of DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION, and notify appropriate
  error message in case of non-existent DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION.

To execute kick-start for Vertica, user has to download
Vertica package from https://my.vertica.com and place
file at DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION and update the value of
DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION to point to actual package-file.

For eg.
if package file-name is vertica.deb and it is placed in /tmp,
then to run kick-start proceed as follows:

  $ export DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION=/tmp/vertica.deb
  $ ./redstack kick-start vertica

Partially Implements: blueprint vertica-db-support

Change-Id: Ibc64b42eb5d2f4722eb27a7bc730dda98014347f

commit_message:
Create DIB elements for HP Vertica on Ubuntu

A specification for this change was submitted for review in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/151126/

Changes:
- Creates the disk-image-builder elements for
  installing HP Vertica on Ubuntu.

- Introduces new env variables DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION which
  specifies location to look for package installer file.

- It would be the job of elements(extra-data.d) to discover
  existence of DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION, and notify appropriate
  error message in case of non-existent DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION.

To execute kick-start for Vertica, user has to download
Vertica package from https://my.vertica.com and place
file at DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION and update the value of
DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION to point to actual package-file.

For eg.
if package file-name is vertica.deb and it is placed in /tmp,
then to run kick-start proceed as follows:

  $ export DATASTORE_PKG_LOCATION=/tmp/vertica.deb
  $ ./redstack kick-start vertica

Partially Implements: blueprint vertica-db-support

Change-Id: Ibc64b42eb5d2f4722eb27a7bc730dda98014347f

commit_message:
Restructure the in-memory node usage

Instead of retaining full paths only retain
partial paths; this then allows for finding
a parent node and then easily finding a child
by using the find() routines.

This more naturally emulates a real filesystem
using our tree structure and simplifies certain
operations to make them more efficient/simple.

Change-Id: I207b02c979704a15eac8be46d11a0af61b05d9b9

commit_message:
Bring EC API calls in sync with PyECLib 1.0

Changes in PyECLib 1.0:

  * All PyECLib exceptions consolidated into one (ECDriverError)
    with improved error handling
  * Uses liberasurecode-provided EC backends
    (some semantic/error reporting changes)
  * EC backend names brought in sync with liberasurecode
    (flat_xor_3 -> flat_xor_hd_3,
     flat_xor_4 -> flat_xor_hd_4,
     jerasure_rs_cauchy_orig -> jerasure_rs_cauchy)

Change-Id: I941541f8043c8a4851815df654e467d42f00c357

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-23 12:03:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Ensure a hypervisor is only managed by a single compute host

Nova does not support a hypervisor managed by more than 1 compute
host. This change makes that lack of support explicit by causing Nova
to raise an exception when attempting to create a compute node which
violates it. If the compute driver reports all nodes at startup, as
the VMware driver does, and Ironic can do, this will cause a
misconfigured Nova to fail to start. This is preferrable to allowing
the system to run, which will require manual cleanup and may result in
data loss.

Specifically, if the compute driver reports a hypervisor node from
get_available_nodes(), Nova assumes that all instances associated with
that node will also have the same compute host. This assumption is
pervasive, and violating it breaks a large number of things. The bug
below notes that the evacuation cleanup code will cause all instances
running on the hypervisor to be erroneously deleted. It will also
prevent all periodic tasks from running correctly.

There are currently only 2 drivers which report a hypervisor identity
different to the compute host: VMware and Ironic. No other drivers
are affected by this change.

Note that this change is not related to support for multiple
hypervisors per compute host. It relates to a single hypervisor being
accidentally managed by multiple compute hosts, which is not
supported.

Closes-Bug: #1419785
Change-Id: I48c2331e66532cd043da8aecdb8e7649776e836a

There are currently only 2 drivers which report a hypervisor identity
different to the compute host: VMware and Ironic. No other drivers

commit_message:
Ensure a hypervisor is only managed by a single compute host

Nova does not support a hypervisor managed by more than 1 compute
host. This change makes that lack of support explicit by causing Nova
to raise an exception when attempting to create a compute node which
violates it. If the compute driver reports all nodes at startup, as
the VMware driver does, and Ironic can do, this will cause a
misconfigured Nova to fail to start. This is preferrable to allowing
the system to run, which will require manual cleanup and may result in
data loss.

Specifically, if the compute driver reports a hypervisor node from
get_available_nodes(), Nova assumes that all instances associated with
that node will also have the same compute host. This assumption is
pervasive, and violating it breaks a large number of things. The bug
below notes that the evacuation cleanup code will cause all instances
running on the hypervisor to be erroneously deleted. It will also
prevent all periodic tasks from running correctly.

There are currently only 2 drivers which report a hypervisor identity
different to the compute host: VMware and Ironic. No other drivers
are affected by this change.

Note that this change is not related to support for multiple
hypervisors per compute host. It relates to a single hypervisor being
accidentally managed by multiple compute hosts, which is not
supported.

Closes-Bug: #1419785
Change-Id: I48c2331e66532cd043da8aecdb8e7649776e836a

commit_message:
Log stdout from build_wheels in cache_devstack

This commit adds a print statement with the stdout from the run_local()
call which executes build_wheels.sh in devstack. Right now when the
script is executed all it does is print that it's running but we are
unable to debug anything that could potentially go wrong during the
execution of the script without the output from build_wheels.

Change-Id: I7433f054127a42fa73598db219c6e351efc98fb7

commit_message:
Update latest modules from oslo-incubator

Updates the _i18n, versionutils, and install_venv_common
modules to the latest from oslo-incubator. The other modules
listed in openstack-common.conf (lockutils, log, importlib, and
fixture) could not be found because they are not part of
oslo-incubator anymore. The log module was updated by hand to
fix a bug, but it and the other deprecated modules should be
replaced with the appropriate substitutions.

Change-Id: I14a7a31e7208a9dc5dbd5686fbeab824b455ffa8
Partial-Bug: 1430124
